content.heading: The Building Blocks
content.text: Every complete sentence must have two essential components: a subject (who or what) and a predicate (what they do or are).

concept_box.title: Complete Sentence Requirements
points: üîç **Subject** - who or what the sentence is about
‚ö° **Predicate** - contains a verb and tells what the subject does
üí≠ **Complete thought** - makes sense on its own

examples.complete: The students studied diligently for their exams.
examples.incomplete: The students studying diligently for their exams.

elements.trigger: Click to see why one is incomplete
elements.reveal: The second example lacks a main verb - 'studying' is a participle, not a complete verb phrase.

slides.title: The SAVE Method for Sentence Errors

content.heading: Strategy: Systematic Error Detection

strategy_steps.title: SUBJECT - Find the subject
strategy_steps.description: Identify who or what the sentence is about
strategy_steps.example: The rapid development of technology ‚Üí Subject: development

strategy_steps.title: ACTION - Locate the main verb
strategy_steps.description: Find the action or state of being
strategy_steps.example: The rapid development of technology has changed ‚Üí Verb: has changed

strategy_steps.title: VOICE - Check for complete thought
strategy_steps.description: Does the sentence express a complete idea?
strategy_steps.example: The rapid development of technology has changed our lives. ‚Üí Complete ‚úì

strategy_steps.title: ENDINGS - Verify proper punctuation
strategy_steps.example: Check for periods, question marks, or exclamation points

content.memory_aid: Remember: **S.A.V.E.** your sentences from common errors!

passage.text: Although renewable energy sources becoming more popular. Many countries still rely heavily on fossil fuels, this creates environmental concerns. Solar panels and wind turbines, which are increasingly efficient. The transition to clean energy requiring significant investment but offering long-term benefits.

guided_questions.question: Find the FRAGMENT in the first sentence
guided_questions.hint: Look for a sentence that doesn't express a complete thought
guided_questions.answer: 'Although renewable energy sources becoming more popular.' - missing main verb
guided_questions.explanation: This has a subject ('sources') but 'becoming' is not a complete verb. It needs 'are becoming' or similar.

guided_questions.question: Identify the RUN-ON in the second sentence
guided_questions.hint: Look for two complete thoughts incorrectly joined
guided_questions.answer: Two complete thoughts joined by a comma: 'Many countries...' and 'this creates...'
guided_questions.explanation: This is a comma splice - two independent clauses joined only by a comma.

guided_questions.question: Spot the final sentence error
guided_questions.hint: Check the last sentence for completeness
guided_questions.answer: 'The transition to clean energy requiring...' - incomplete verb form
guided_questions.explanation: 'Requiring' should be 'requires' to make this a complete sentence.

passage.text: The concept of artificial intelligence has evolved dramatically over the past decade. With machine learning algorithms becoming more sophisticated, they can now perform tasks that were once thought impossible for computers. However, concerns about AI replacing human jobs, this has led to important discussions about the future of work.

question.text: Which choice best fixes the sentence error in the passage?
options: However, concerns about AI replacing human jobs. This has led to important discussions about the future of work.
However, concerns about AI replacing human jobs, and this has led to important discussions about the future of work.
However, concerns about AI replacing human jobs have led to important discussions about the future of work.
However, concerns about AI replacing human jobs; this has led to important discussions about the future of work.

explanations.A: This creates a sentence fragment - 'concerns about AI replacing human jobs' lacks a main verb.
explanations.B: This creates a run-on sentence with an unnecessary 'and' conjunction.
explanations.C: ‚úì Correct! This fixes the comma splice by combining the ideas into one complete sentence with the verb 'have led.'
explanations.D: While grammatically correct, this solution is wordier than necessary and less elegant than option C.

content.heading: Apply Your Knowledge
content.instructions: These questions mirror the actual SAT format. Use the SAVE method to identify and fix sentence structure errors.

questions.passage: Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, she was also the first person to win Nobel Prizes in two different scientific fields. Her groundbreaking research on radioactivity. This work laid the foundation for modern atomic physics and led to numerous medical applications.
questions.question: Which choice best improves the sentence structure of the passage?
options: Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize; she was also the first person to win Nobel Prizes in two different scientific fields.
Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, and she was also the first person to win Nobel Prizes in two different scientific fields.
Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the first person to win Nobel Prizes in two different scientific fields.
NO CHANGE

questions.passage: The development of sustainable transportation options becoming increasingly important as cities seek to reduce carbon emissions. Electric vehicles, public transit systems, and bike-sharing programs all contributing to cleaner urban environments.
questions.question: Which choice best fixes the sentence structure errors?
options: The development of sustainable transportation options is becoming increasingly important as cities seek to reduce carbon emissions. Electric vehicles, public transit systems, and bike-sharing programs all contribute to cleaner urban environments.

The development of sustainable transportation options becoming increasingly important as cities seek to reduce carbon emissions, electric vehicles, public transit systems, and bike-sharing programs all contributing to cleaner urban environments.

The development of sustainable transportation options is becoming increasingly important. As cities seek to reduce carbon emissions, electric vehicles, public transit systems, and bike-sharing programs all contributing to cleaner urban environments.
NO CHANGE

key_points.title: Complete Sentences
key_points.description: Every sentence needs a subject, predicate, and complete thought.

key_points.title: Common Errors
key_points.description: Watch for fragments (incomplete thoughts), run-ons (multiple thoughts), and comma splices.

key_points.title: The SAVE Method
key_points.description: Subject ‚Üí Action ‚Üí Voice ‚Üí Endings. This systematic approach catches most errors.

key_points.title: SAT Strategy
key_points.description: On the SAT, the shortest, clearest option that fixes the error is usually correct.

next_steps.preview: You'll learn to use commas, semicolons, and other punctuation marks to create clear, effective sentences.

content.heading: Final Assessment
content.instructions: Demonstrate your mastery of sentence structure by fixing this complex error.

passage.text: Climate change representing one of the most significant challenges of our time. Scientists worldwide studying its effects, they have found that rising temperatures are causing more frequent extreme weather events. These findings highlighting the urgent need for global action to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

question.text: Which choice best fixes all the sentence structure errors in the passage?
options: Climate change represents one of the most significant challenges of our time. Scientists worldwide have studied its effects and found that rising temperatures are causing more frequent extreme weather events. These findings highlight the urgent need for global action to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

Climate change representing one of the most significant challenges of our time, scientists worldwide studying its effects, they have found that rising temperatures are causing more frequent extreme weather events, these findings highlighting the urgent need for global action.

Climate change represents one of the most significant challenges of our time; scientists worldwide studying its effects, they have found that rising temperatures are causing more frequent extreme weather events; these findings highlighting the urgent need for global action.

Climate change representing one of the most significant challenges of our time. Scientists worldwide studying its effects and finding that rising temperatures are causing more frequent extreme weather events. These findings highlighting the urgent need for global action.

practice_questions.question: Which is a complete sentence?
options: Running through the park on a sunny day.
Because the weather was perfect for outdoor activities.
The children played happily in the park.
After finishing their homework assignments.

strategy_card.title: Sentence Structure Quick Reference
tips: Every sentence needs subject + predicate + complete thought
Watch for fragments, run-ons, and comma splices
The simplest correct option is usually best

common_mistakes: Joining independent clauses with only commas
Creating sentence fragments with subordinating words
Using overly complex punctuation when simple works better
